projects.title: Ionic Plasma Thruster
projects.subtitle: Fuel-less Propulsion System
projects.description: This project focused on designing and implementing a fuel-less ionic propulsion system that generates thrust using high-voltage corona discharge and plasma wind, without any moving parts or fuel. The system utilized arc generator modules connected to ring electrodes to produce directional thrust through ionized air particles.

projects.title: Smart HUB75 LED Panel Display
projects.subtitle: Digital Display System
projects.description: Similar to large Advertisement panels, this project involved designing and implementing an advanced digital display panel system using two chained P3 64x64 HUB75 LED panels, tailored for the Career Center at the University of Prince Mugrin. The system featured real-time content updates, smooth animations, and network connectivity for remote management.

projects.title: Axial-flux Electric Generator
projects.subtitle: DIY Power Generation
projects.description: Partnered with a colleague to design and assemble a low-cost DIY axial flux electric generator. With eight 250-turn coils and 32 magnets mounted on CD discs, we achieved a 3V output, showcasing our resourcefulness and ingenuity. This project earned us second place in the university engineering competition.

projects.description: Created an interactive and feature-rich to-do list web application utilizing JavaScript. The app allowed users to manage tasks efficiently by storing data locally in the browser, and it offered functionalities such as due dates, task status tracking, priority levels, and filtering options for enhanced productivity.

The project features an interactive user interface where players can select their choice, while the computer randomly generates its move. The game logic determines the winner, displays results dynamically, and keeps track of the score.

projects.title: Python Interactive COVID-19 Data Visualization Map
projects.subtitle: Data Science & Visualization

Leveraging Python's Folium library and HTML I-frames, the project provided users with insightful visualizations of pandemic trends, regional statistics, and temporal analysis of infection rates.
